flow.descriptionCdata:
9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.18898b9d-7246-40e4-93a5-03eab0593812.description=
Finds the primary domain controller for a domain via DNS lookup.

Inputs\:
    domain - The name of the domain to find the domain controller for
    dnsServer - The DNS server to query

Responses\:
     success - The operation completed as stated in the description
     failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully

Returns\:
The fully qualified host name of the PDC.
9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.2040b273-73e8-4200-8bc2-1a0268452a08.description=
Searches the NT Event Log using the supplied search criteria.

Inputs\:
    host - Host name or IP address of the machine to search 
    user -  Username to use for WMI impersonation on the host for this operation (to be left blank for localhost)
    password - Password of the user
    log - The name of the Event Log to search. Example\: Application, System, Security or *.
    age - The number of seconds old an event can be to be counted.  Use * for all.
    severity - The severity of the event.  Use * for all. Valid values\: error, information, warning, *.
    threshold - The value used to determine the response
    eventid - The id of the event
    source - The source of the event
    message - The message text of the searched events. If blank, the search ignores the message. 

Responses\:
    over threshold - The number of events found was equal to or higher than the input parameter threshold
    under threshold - The number of events found was lower than the input parameter threshold
    host not found - Host could not be resolved
    invalid parameters - An unknown error occurred

Extra Results\:
    count - The total number of events found that match the criteria
    logs - The actual logs captured

Notes\: 
1. The username and password inputs must be blank for localhost and fully qualified usernames must be used for remote hosts
     Example\:    user\: DOMAIN\Administrator
                        password\: password

2. If a hostname is assigned to the host input, make sure that the DNS server you set is correct, otherwise the hostname will not be resolved.
9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.21c805bc-bd99-4a6c-a07a-d536fd8ff753.description=
Changes the status of a Windows service to the requested status.

Inputs\:
    host - The hostname or IP address of the target machine
    service - The name of the service to change
    requestedstatus - The requested service status. Valid values are\: running, stopped, paused.
    user - The username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (Example\: domain\username). 
    password - The user password
    startdependants - Start all dependent services. Valid values are\: true, false.
    serviceTimeout - The maximum time, in seconds, a single service can take (this affects the main service and the dependent services)
    operationTimeout - The maximum time, in seconds, the operation can take for all services combined

Responses\:
    service paused - The service is currently paused
    service running - The service is currently running
    service stopped - The service is currently stopped
    service pending - The service is currently pending
    failure - There was a problem setting the state of the service
9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.29aae291-a05b-43cf-9b2e-0c998e0535f7.prompt=Alternate Credentials - Password\: 9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.34b91f86-f069-426f-afe4-cea91e10c7d5.prompt=HostName\: 9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.390776c5-b10c-430c-8d9c-768b058f900d.prompt=Alternate Credentials - UserName\: 9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.4917cd69-8ddb-4224-beab-e381a3d43244.prompt=DNSserver\: 9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.65f7cf4c-af81-4138-8b34-1b4ab9d11908.prompt=Alternate Credentials - Password\: 9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.79a82a91-148b-404c-8234-e3e25023ff55.description=
Makes a backup copy of the active directory root hints.

Inputs\:
host - the domain controller to make the copy on.
altuser - The user to authenticate to host as.
altpass - the password for altuser.

Responses\:
success - The root hints were copied successfully.
failure - The copy failed.
9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.b802450a-1c48-48e3-80c3-3243aa2164a6.description=
Searches the NT Event Log using the supplied search criteria.

Inputs\:
    host - Host name or IP address of the machine to search 
    user -  Username to use for WMI impersonation on the host for this operation (to be left blank for localhost)
    password - Password of the user
    log - The name of the Event Log to search. Example\: Application, System, Security or *.
    age - The number of seconds old an event can be to be counted.  Use * for all.
    severity - The severity of the event.  Use * for all. Valid values\: error, information, warning, *.
    threshold - The value used to determine the response
    eventid - The id of the event
    source - The source of the event
    message - The message text of the searched events. If blank, the search ignores the message. 

Responses\:
    over threshold - The number of events found was equal to or higher than the input parameter threshold
    under threshold - The number of events found was lower than the input parameter threshold
    host not found - Host could not be resolved
    invalid parameters - An unknown error occurred

Extra Results\:
    count - The total number of events found that match the criteria
    logs - The actual logs captured

Notes\: 
1. The username and password inputs must be blank for localhost and fully qualified usernames must be used for remote hosts
     Example\:    user\: DOMAIN\Administrator
                        password\: password

2. If a hostname is assigned to the host input, make sure that the DNS server you set is correct, otherwise the hostname will not be resolved.
9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.bce251da-ef40-4953-925d-fe454c2fa71d.prompt=Enter a value for dnsServer 9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.cbcb299d-e5e2-4d36-83a2-7d5ed807f7f2.prompt=Enter a value for domain 9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.cdbbb822-4bfc-4f79-9e31-1b88e361df91.description=
Changes the status of a Windows service to the requested status.

Inputs\:
    host - The hostname or IP address of the target machine
    service - The name of the service to change
    requestedstatus - The requested service status. Valid values are\: running, stopped, paused.
    user - The username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (Example\: domain\username). 
    password - The user password
    startdependants - Start all dependent services. Valid values are\: true, false.
    serviceTimeout - The maximum time, in seconds, a single service can take (this affects the main service and the dependent services)
    operationTimeout - The maximum time, in seconds, the operation can take for all services combined

Responses\:
    service paused - The service is currently paused
    service running - The service is currently running
    service stopped - The service is currently stopped
    service pending - The service is currently pending
    failure - There was a problem setting the state of the service
9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.d64f5864-a758-4156-9cd7-1fa671a5414c.prompt=Domain\: 9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.description=
Finds the primary domain controller for a domain via DNS lookup and checks if root hints are missing. If they are missing, it replaces them with the root hints from the cache.dns file.

Inputs\:
    domain - The name of the domain whose domain controller you want to find
    dnsServer - The DNS server to query
    altuser - The username to use when authenticating to the primary domain controller
    altpass - The password for altuser

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description but problems were found
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully. See the Notes for troubleshooting help.
    no problem found - No problems were found

Note\:
Make sure that the DNS server you have set is correct, otherwise the hostname will not be resolved when searching for event logs and the flow will fail.
9a8d7cda-6e5c-47ff-9be4-90b3a96e6069.f5034c8b-f4d6-41ce-adaa-3e638d185340.prompt=Alternate Credentials - UserName\:
